properties.name: logging.datasource.url
properties.description: JDBC URL of the datasource used for writing application logs.

properties.name: logging.datasource.username
properties.description: Username for authenticating to the logging datasource.

properties.name: logging.datasource.password
properties.description: Password for authenticating to the logging datasource.

properties.name: logging.datasource.driver-class-name
properties.description: Fully qualified JDBC driver class name for the logging datasource.

properties.name: rate.limit.capacity
properties.description: Maximum number of requests allowed in a burst for each client.

properties.name: rate.limit.tokens
properties.description: Number of tokens to refill into the bucket at each refill interval.

properties.name: rate.limit.duration-minutes
properties.description: Refill interval in minutes during which the specified tokens are added.

properties.name: rate.limit.cache-expiry-minutes
properties.description: Time-to-live (in seconds) for each clientâ€™s rate-limit bucket in the in-memory cache.

properties.name: security.cros.allowed-origins
properties.description: Comma-separated list of allowed origins for CORS requests (e.g., https://example.com).

properties.name: security.cros.allowed-methods
properties.description: Comma-separated list of allowed HTTP methods for CORS (e.g., GET, POST, PUT).

properties.name: security.cros.allowed-headers
properties.description: Comma-separated list of HTTP headers that are allowed in CORS requests.

properties.name: security.cros.allowed-allow-credentials
properties.description: Flag (1 or 0) indicating whether user credentials (cookies, authorization headers) are allowed in CORS requests.
